trial_identification.studytitle: Examining the incidence of preoperative frailty and its correlation with recovery from anaesthesia
trial_identification.scientifictitle: In patients aged over 70 undergoing minor surgery, does the presence of preoperative frailty compared to absence of preoperative frailty correlate with poorer recovery from anaesthesia?

interventions.interventions: Frailty as determined using the Edmonton Frail Scale will be measured preoperatively and compared with postoperative recovery at Day 1 as measured by the Postoperative Quality Recovery Scale

primaryOutcome.outcome: Recovery from anaesthesia determined by postoperative quality of recovery (PQRS) score

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Age 70 and over. Undergoing day case surgery or an overnight stay involving sedation or general anaesthesia at Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre (PMCC).

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Department of Surgical Oncology Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre, A'Beckett Street East Melbourne Victoria 8006

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This project aims to estimate the incidence of preoperative frailty in patients undergoing minor surgery at Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre, and to explore the correlation between preoperative frailty and recovery from surgery. It will also explore the practicality of assessing frailty using the Edmonton Frail Scale in a preanaesthetic environment.
